text:
PLACEMENT SERVICE
PAGE 2
March 8, Experienced manager with six years of teaching in college
and four years commercial experience on the executive level desires
more challenging position. Age—35, married, doctoral candidate,
and can furnish better than average references.
March 9. Studio technician and programming, production assistant.
Experienced beginner available.' University courses in programming
and production. 300 hours technical instruction in the use and
maintenance of studio equipment. Practical experience in program¬
ming and production for municipal educational station. Production
work for Armed Forces Radio. Salary open. Will relocate.
March 10. Position desired-Production Manager, Program Director or
Producer-Director. Bachelor of Arts Degree - Major in Speech and
Theatre Arts. Over four and one-half years experience in radio and
television. Radio - Staff announcer, Sports Director, Program
Director. Television - Staff announcer, Producer-Director, Continuity
Director. Prefer position in Northeast section of United States.
March 11. Now employed in commercial radio-television station,
desire to enter educational radio-television. Wide experience at
several Eastern radio stations, including two 50kw stations, and at
two television stations, one VHF, one UHF. Harvard S.B. and an
A.M. in English. Taught English eight years, six in college, two
in prep school. Free-lance writing nationally and regionally.
Would be good supervising students in college station. Married, 34.
Need at least $5000 a year.
March 12. VERSATILE, EXPERIENCED RADIO-TV WORKER. Experienced as
Film Director, Chief Cameraman, Floor Manager, Continuity Writer,
Director, and Announcer. Worked in small TV station where brains
and versatility are "mustsi" Now available for immediate work.
